segments.source_content:
---
slug: /154
title: "This Week In React #154: Server Components, Remix, Next.js, Redwood, Million, Lucia, ElementRef, Partially Controlled, SVG Sprites, NextUI, Storybook, Hermes, require.context..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 08-01-2023
image: /img/TWIR_POST.png
---
Once again this week, we've got some great React articles, especially on Server Components!

translations.fr: Encore une fois cette semaine, nous avons d'excellents articles sur React, notamment sur les Server Components !
translations.en: Encore une fois cette semaine, nous avons d'excellents articles sur React, notamment sur les Server Components !

segments.source_content: Last week, I asked whether you preferred direct links or links to Twitter. Your answer was unanimous: **direct links**. On top of that, the Twitter/X experience has been degraded for anonymous users who can no longer see the discussions. So I'll try to avoid Twitter links, with a few exceptions for which I'll use the ğŸ¦ emoji.

segments.source_content: Managing or migrating large apps and codebases? This video course covers what you need to know to scale efficiently whilst maintaining code quality. Covers unit testing, CI pipelines, mocking, code coverage, and more.

translations.fr: Vous gÃ©rez ou migrez des applications et des bases de code volumineuses ? Ce cours vidÃ©o couvre ce que vous devez savoir pour Ã©voluer efficacement tout en maintenant la qualitÃ© du code. segments.source_content: New Vercel article that gives a good overview of React Server Components, their implementation in Next.js, why they exist, when to use them and their limitations. Also covers various related topics: Server Actions, code-splitting, caching, suspense, selective hydration...

translations.fr: Nouvel article de Vercel qui donne une bonne vue d'ensemble des composants serveur React, leur implÃ©mentation dans Next.js, pourquoi ils existent, quand les utiliser et leurs limites. Aborde Ã©galement divers sujets connexes : Server Actions, code-splitting, mise en cache, suspense, hydratation sÃ©lective...
translations.en: Nouvel article de Vercel qui donne un bon aperÃ§u des React Server Components, leur implÃ©mentation dans Next.js, pourquoi ils existent, quand les utiliser et leurs limites. Couvre Ã©galement divers sujets connexes : les Server Actions, le code-splitting, le caching, le suspense, l'hydratation sÃ©lective...

segments.source_content: Awesome article on RSCs! Feedback that details the 3 main challenges encountered during the adoption at Mux: no CSS-in-JS, no React Context, and additional complexity. Also provides answers to many questions and a strategy for adopting RSCs incrementally.

translations.fr: Super article sur les RSCs ! Retour d'expÃ©rience qui dÃ©taille les 3 principaux dÃ©fis rencontrÃ©s lors de l'adoption chez Mux : pas de CSS-in-JS, pas de React Context, et une complexitÃ© supplÃ©mentaire. Fournit Ã©galement des rÃ©ponses Ã  de nombreuses questions et une stratÃ©gie pour adopter les RSCs de maniÃ¨re incrÃ©mentale.
translations.en: Superbe article sur les RSC ! Retour d'expÃ©rience dÃ©taillant les 3 principaux dÃ©fis rencontrÃ©s lors de l'adoption chez Mux : pas de CSS-in-JS, pas de React Context, et une complexitÃ© supplÃ©mentaire. Apporte Ã©galement des rÃ©ponses Ã  de nombreuses questions et une stratÃ©gie pour adopter les RSC progressivement.

- ğŸ‘€ [React Working Group - List of libraries that support React Server Components](https://github.com/reactwg/server-components/discussions/6)
- ğŸ¦ [React devs, it's time to start using `Array.prototype.with()`](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1686059338647957509)
- ğŸ“œ [Speeding up the dbtâ„¢ docs by 20x with React Server Components](https://dagster.io/blog/dbt-docs-on-react): feedback on a POC migration of an Angular 1 app to Next.js App Router and React Server Components. Very significant gains reported in terms of loading time, memory consumption, CPU blocking.
- ğŸ“œ [Shopifyâ€™s platform is the Web platform](https://shopify.engineering/shopifys-platform-is-the-web-platform): Shopify now recommends Remix for creating "Admin Apps", which run in an iframe and communicate with the parent app via an "App Bridge" based on `postMessage()`. An interesting frontend/React architecture for those building a platform that need decoupling.
- ğŸ“œ [Partially Controlled Components: A Declarative Design Pattern in React](https://www.jameskerr.blog/posts/partially-controlled-react-components/): introduces a new term/concept to describe components capable of offering both controlled/uncontrolled state on demand, with granularity applicable to the whole state, or a slice of it.
- ğŸ“œ [Use svg sprite icons in React](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/svg-icons): explains how to use SVG sprites (more optimised than React SVG components) in a Remix context with a codegen step.
- ğŸ“œ [Strongly Type useRef with ElementRef](https://www.totaltypescript.com/strongly-type-useref-with-elementref): TIL about the `ElementRef` TypeScript type, which is used to obtain the type of a React ref from any component, quite similarly to how `ComponentProps` works.
- ğŸ“œ [10 Essential React Performance Optimization Techniques for Faster Web Applications](https://techreactlearning.blogspot.com/2023/07/10-essential-react-performance.html)
- ğŸ“œ [Remix Error Handling Essentials](https://otiv.dev/blog/essential-remix-error-handling)
- ğŸ“¦ [Lucia v2.0](https://lucia-auth.com/blog/lucia-2): Lucia is a TypeScript authentication library gaining momentum recently. Including Next.js and Remix integrations.
- ğŸ“¦ [Million.js Automatic Mode beta](https://million.dev/docs/automatic): now analyses your React code and automatically optimises it with Million.js!
- ğŸ“¦ [Redwood v6](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v6.0.0): new stable release with Vite, Prisma 5, Storybook 7, Suspense Router... Prepares the ground for the introduction of streaming support and React Server components.
- ğŸ“¦ [NextUI Version 2.0](https://nextui.org/blog/nextui-v2)

- ğŸ“¦ [Auto-Form - Automatically creates a @shadcn/ui form based on a zod schema](https://github.com/vantezzen/auto-form)

- ğŸ“¦ [Zustand 4.4](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand/releases/tag/v4.4.0)

- drag and drop a React (and Angular or Vue) repo
- add packages with npm install
- let candidates use ChatGPT live in the interview
- watch & share code playback after the interview

segments.source_content: The developers at BAM benchmarked the impact of the Hermes runtime on the app start-up time and memory consumption of a React-Native Android app using their [Flashlight](https://github.com/bamlab/flashlight) performance tool. For those who were still in doubt, Hermes clearly outperforms JSC.

translations.fr: Les dÃ©veloppeurs de BAM ont Ã©valuÃ© l'impact du runtime Hermes sur le temps de dÃ©marrage et la consommation mÃ©moire d'une application Android React-Native avec leur outil de performance [Flashlight](https://github.com/bamlab/flashlight). Pour ceux qui doutaient encore, Hermes surpasse clairement JSC.
translations.en: Les dÃ©veloppeurs de BAM ont Ã©valuÃ© l'impact du runtime Hermes sur le temps de dÃ©marrage et la consommation mÃ©moire d'une application React-Native Android en utilisant leur outil de performance [Flashlight](https://github.com/bamlab/flashlight). Pour ceux qui doutaient encore, Hermes surpasse clairement JSC.

- ğŸ“œ [Dynamic imports supported in react native](https://dev.to/dannyhw/dynamic-imports-supported-in-react-native-273j): the Webpack feature `require.context` (used to import a folder of modules dynamically) has been ported to Metro for the needs of Expo Router. This allows [Storybook React-Native 6.5.5](https://github.com/storybookjs/react-native/releases/tag/v6.5.5) to create an index of stories without a codegen step (in preview), and opens up other interesting possibilities.

segments.source_content: Passionfroot's mission is to empower the independent businesses of tomorrow via YouTube, Podcasts, Social Media, and Newsletters. Join us in building a tool that will empower creators globally to build scalable, sustainable businesses.

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.
